title: [Large-Scale] STEM-PBL-Based Renewable Energy Engineering Design Course for Sustainable Development Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics (functions, statistics), physics (principles of energy conversion), and foundational engineering design concepts
context.additional_context: Project-based education emphasizing systems thinking competencies in smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Students enhance their ability to predict energy production through mathematical modeling of renewable energy systems (solar, wind).
Learners apply the five stages of the Engineering Design Process (EDP) (Define-Research-Develop-Produce-Evaluate) to create design plans for sustainable energy solutions.
Achieve over 80% proficiency in systems thinking competencies (causal analysis, holistic understanding) through team-based problem-solving activities

resources: Renewable Energy Dataset (KMA/Korea Energy Agency Open Data)
Low-Cost Mobile Measurement Kit (Lux Meter, Anemometer)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
